name: FastAPI
description: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance) web framework for building APIs with Python 3.6+ based on standard Python type hints. It is the framework we use to build the L2C Journal application and what you will use as well.

learning_steps.title: FastAPI official tutorial
learning_steps.description: Work through the official FastAPI tutorial by the framework creator. This comprehensive guide covers everything from basic setup to advanced features.

questions.prompt: What makes FastAPI different from other Python web frameworks, and why would you choose it?
scenario_seeds: Your team is starting a new microservice and debating between Flask, Django, and FastAPI. Make the case for FastAPI.
A colleague says they don't see the point of type hints in Python. Explain how FastAPI leverages them for automatic validation and docs.
You need to build a high-performance API that will handle thousands of concurrent requests. Explain why FastAPI is well-suited for this.
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain automatic API documentation (Swagger/OpenAPI) AND type hints enabling validation via Pydantic AND async support for performance.

questions.prompt: Walk me through how path parameters and query parameters work in FastAPI and when you'd use each.
scenario_seeds: You're building an API endpoint to get a specific user's orders with optional date filtering. Design the URL structure.
A junior developer is confused why sometimes data goes in the URL path and sometimes after a question mark. Explain the difference.
Your API needs to support getting a single item by ID and listing items with pagination. Show how path and query params handle each case.
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain path parameters are part of the URL for identifying resources AND query parameters are optional for filtering/pagination AND show how FastAPI extracts both from function arguments.

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you ask me to explain what FastAPI is and how it works?
Can you quiz me on how to create a FastAPI application and define endpoints?
Can you ask me to explain how to handle request and response models in FastAPI?
Can you ask me to explain how to use path parameters and query parameters in FastAPI?
Can you quiz me on how to use dependency injection in FastAPI?
Can you ask me to explain how to use Pydantic models in FastAPI?
Can you ask me to explain how to use FastAPI with asynchronous code?
